SEARCH
Package org.example.users

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
org.example.users.UserController
public class UserController extends Object
The UserController class provides functionality to read user data from a text file, convert it to a JSON format, and write it to a JSON file. This class utilizes Google's Gson library for JSON processing and Java NIO for file operations.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method that serves as the entry point of the application. It reads user data from a text file and writes it to a JSON file.
      Parameters:
      args - Command line arguments (not used in this application).

    • writeJsonToFile

      protected static void writeJsonToFile(List<User> users, String fileName)
      Writes a list of users to a JSON file.
      Parameters:
      users - The list of users to be written to the JSON file.
      fileName - The name of the JSON file where the user data will be written.

    • readJsonFromFile

      protected static List<User> readJsonFromFile(String fileName) throws IOException
      Reads a list of users from a JSON file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the JSON file from which the user data will be read.
      Returns:
      A list of users read from the JSON file.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file.

    • readUsersFromFile

      public static List<User> readUsersFromFile(Path filePath) throws IOException
      Reads user data from a text file and returns a list of users. The text file is expected to have a header line followed by lines of user data. Each line of user data should contain the user's name and age separated by whitespace.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the text file containing the user data.
      Returns:
      A list of users read from the text file.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file.
